intro: Schizophragma molle, commonly known as the climbing smilacoid, is a woody vine native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its twining stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by red, berry-like fruits. Schizophragma molle thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking a vigorous, climbing plant.
